the customer wants from your product and
like you know create a road map saying

on give it to engineering teams and ask

but value curves is a little different
it is primarily focused on the value the

against the traditional thinking of
features and it is more about like what

to the user for example like let's say
we pick a collaboration tool as a
product Right Now features in these
collaboration tool can be visually it

for sharing of files or like you know
those can be the kind of features but
when you think of values it is a slight

the customer values the communication to

to the customer now the customer wants
to engage with anybody who is in the

now that is a value so first like within
this value Curve Model a product manager
really identifies the core values which

customers understands how these values

engineering teams as a like the
subsequent thing is to Define features

it is purely driven by values and not

Value curves and its significance to
engineering teams there are multiple
ways this can benefit the engineering
teams one is in terms of the right way
of backlog grooming and prioritization
Now features also yes there is a
specific way of doing backlog grooming
which engineering team does but I think
when you translate this into value based
road map the engineers and the team
engineering teams are better able to
groom the backlog and they're able to
take the prioritization decisions in a
more effective way because values are
again going to translate to the success
of the product second is the design and
the architectural decisions now if we
think about the traditional model right
because they are like you know given as
a list of features now if an engineer is
building for the features their design
or architectural choices are going to be
based on the features which are at hand
but thinking in terms of value it kind
of changes their thinking to build for
longer term value which the product
should offer to the customers and that
kind of changes the design and
Architectural decisions and third
prototyping and experimentation like
Engineers can actually leverage the
value curves to rapidly prototype and
also test design Alternatives which
which again is not very suitable with
the like you know feature based road map
definition and I think one other thing
is cross functional alignment this is
one of the major problems which we
encounter or which the engineering teams
encounter when there are dependencies
with other teams to build a specific
feature in a product it is very hard to
get the buying from the dependency teams
for them to prioritize the work in their
plan like when it is based on features
but when you think of value and value

there are two things which I constantly

women have this constant fear and

when they are in conversations or

women generally tend to take a step back

Tech type space what's involved

because this is not counted in
